hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: When a significant negative news catalyst (e.g., large liquidation event, regulatory headline) causes a sharp 1-hour price drop (>3%) on elevated volume (>150% of 20-day avg) in a NEUTRAL regime, the subsequent 4-hour period will exhibit a mean-reverting bounce of at least 50% of the initial drop, as panic selling exhausts and algorithmic buyers step in.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack strong directional momentum, making exaggerated moves on news prone to quick reversals. High volume confirms capitulation, while compressed RSI signals short-term exhaustion. Algorithmic strategies often fade extreme moves in neutral environments.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour candle closes down >3% on volume >150% of 20-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 1-hour drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below the low of the catalyst candle by 0.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such signals lead to further downside (breaking catalyst low) within the 4-hour window instead of a bounce.
